questions.question: A known volume of HCl solution of exactly known concentration is allowed to react with a strong alkali in dilute solution. Which of the following best describes the mentioned reaction?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Heat of solution refers to dissolving a substance in solvent.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Heat of dilution involves adding more solvent.
explanations.c: Correct. This is a classic example of heat of neutralization.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Heat of formation relates to forming compounds from elements.

questions.question: The amount of heat evolved when 1 g equivalent of the base is completely neutralised by a strong acid in a dilute solution is called........

answers.a: Heat of neutralisation of a acid
answers.d: Heat of neutralisation of a base

explanations.a: Incorrect. The correct terminology involves base here.
explanations.b: Incorrect. There is a correct term listed.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This is about dilution, not neutralisation.
